result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:39 pm - Defendant John Robert Franz in court.  Attorney Christine Bruen in court for John Robert Franz.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial. 
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Scheduling conference on October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:55 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John Robert Franz in court.  Attorney Christine Bruen in court for John Robert Franz. Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Motion and Order to Modify Bond.
The Court orders that the defendant's bond dated 06-16-22, be modified to allow the defendant and K.F. to have contact, by only non-assaultive contact.  All prior orders of the court not specifically modified by this order shall remain in full force and effect.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond.

records.addlTxt:
2:51 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John Robert Franz in court.  Defendant is planning to proceed without counsel in this matter.  The Court explains to the defendant that he is being charged with a felony and points out the possible penalties associated with that.  The defendant reconsiders and wishes to speak with an attorney.  PFAC forms given to the defendant.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 06-16-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime or substantial battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-11-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with K.F.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTSO.
Minutes.
